p: Sixty New Zealand White rabbits (male, 5-weeks old) were weighed and randomly allotted to three dietary treatments containing three amounts of paulownia powder (0%, 15%, and 30%) for 8 weeks. Each treatment involved 10 cages, where two animals were maintained in 1 cage. The rabbits were housed in the cages (30 cm width × 50 cm length × 40 cm height) and reared under the same managerial conditions, and they were fed to achieve their requirements, according to De Blas and Mateos [ 15]. All diets were formulated, pelleted, and stored in the farm during the study ( Table 1). The ingredient and diet analyses were performed according to AOAC [ 11].
